Name: Funerary net elements strung as necklace
Description: String of tubular beads originally in a bead-net covering for a mummy, with part of a figure of Amset, one of the four sons of Horus, the divine guardians of the more vulnerable inner organs. The figures of the four sons of Horus formed part of the mummy nets, placed over the wrapped body in burials from about 700 to 100 BC.
